keywords: The Splendid Table's How to Eat Weekends
name: Cucumber & Melon Salad with Mint
description: While tomatoes and peaches aren't worth bothering with during the cooler months, cucumbers and melons fare much better. This Cucumber & Melon Salad with Mint from Lynne Rossetto Kasper's and Sally Swift's The Splendid Table's How to Eat Weekends is a sweet way to ease into fall without going cold turkey on the summery produce.
recipeYield: serves 2 as a main dish and 4 as a first course or side dish
recipeIngredient: 2 medium cucumbers, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch pieces (about 1 1/2 cups)
1 1/2 cups ripe cantaloupe or watermelon, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks
1/4 tightly-packed cup fresh spearmint leaves, torn
1 heaping tablespoon finely snipped chives or scallions (green parts only)
1 tablespoon white wine, or to taste
1 tablespoon good-tasting extra-virgin olive oil, or to taste
1/4 cup crumbled young sheep cheese (Ricotta Salata, Cacio di Roma, Pecorino, or feta)

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the cucumbers with salt, roll up the pieces in a double thickness of paper towel, and let rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Unwrap and pat dry.
Rub a serving bowl with the garlic. Add the cucumbers, melon, spearmint, chives, 1 tablespoon wine, and 1 tablespoon oil. Gently combine. Add wine, oil, salt, pepper, and sugar (if using) to taste.
Serve topped with spoonfuls of crumbled cheese and eat immediately.
